title: As a user I want to be able to create a new Assign as 7th Coach transaction for an employee
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is in Employee Profile
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on "Create New" button on the Employee Profile
custom_expected:
THEN " Employee Transaction" is an option in the top-level dropdown.
AND Selecting "Employee Transaction" will display a secondary and tertiary dropdown.
AND "Assignments" should be an option under the secondary dropdown. 
AND "Assign as 7th Coach" should be an option in the third level dropdown when "Assignments" is selected.
AND Selecting "Assign as 7th Coach" from the Create New will check to see if there is an existing Preliminary transaction of the same type for the same employee created within 10 days of the current date. 
AND If a preliminary already exists, the system will load the existing transaction in Edit Mode instead of opening a new transaction. 
OR If no preliminary transaction created within the last 10 days already exists, then the system will load a new Preliminary transaction in edit mode. 
AND Transaction should follow the wireframe and data discovery.

See Wireframe: 
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=assign_as_7th_coach

title: As a user I want to be able to save a new Assign as 7th Coach transaction for an employee
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is in employee profile
custom_steps: WHEN user opens a new Assign as 7th Coach transaction in edit mode for an employee
custom_expected:
THEN Save button will be available anytime the form is in edit mode.
AND Clicking Save will save the transaction and it's current values.
AND Transaction status will be set to "Preliminary" if this is the first time the transaction is being saved. Otherwise the transaction status will not change.
AND After a successful save the system will display a successful save blue notification.
AND Whenever the form is in edit mode, the user will see a "Cancel" button on the form in grey.
AND Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel the changes they have made.
AND If they confirm the cancellation and the form has not yet been saved in the system, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction.
Or If they confirm the cancellation and the form has been previously saved in the system, then the form should be reloaded in the default mode (view/edit) for the current transaction state, with none of the edits that were made since the last save and up to the cancellation point reflected.
OR If they do not confirm the cancellation then the user will be returned to the form and no action will be taken.

Wireframe:
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=assign_as_7th_coach

title: As a user I want to Submit an Assign as 7th Coach to the BOC for approval
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is attempting to submit an Assign as 7th Coach transaction
AND transaction is in preliminary or rejected state
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Submit" or "Submit to BOC" button (Blue for Club users and grey for the BOC)
custom_expected:
THEN system will run a required field and formatting check, as well as all on Submit rules. Once the rule checks have been passed or overridden, the system will save the transaction and its current values.
AND Transaction status will be set to "Submitted to BOC".
AND After a successful submission the system will display a successful submit blue notification. 
AND An approvals item will be generated for the BOC. 
AND The transaction is added to the Player's History in green font: Code =AS7CO Description = Assign as 7th Coach , From Org/Club fields

Wireframe:
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=assign_as_7th_coach

title: As a BOC user I want to approve an Assign as 7th Coach transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an Assign as 7th Coach transaction is in Preliminary, Submitted to BOC, or Rejected status
AND blue "Approve" button is available
custom_steps: WHEN the BOC user clicks "Approve"
custom_expected:
THEN Clicking "Approve" will run all required field, formatting, On Submit and On Approve rules checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. 
AND Once all rules have passed or been overridden, the transaction status is updated to "Approved"
AND If the item was in edit mode, it is reloaded in view mode. 
AND If applicable, the BOC approvals item is removed.
AND A successful blue notification is displayed that states the transaction was approved.
AND Update Player's Player History: Code =AS7CO Description = Assign as 7th Coach , From Org/Club fields in black font.

title: As a BOC user I want to reject an Assign as 7th Coach transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an Assign as 7th Coach transaction has been submitted to BOC
AND grey "Reject" button is available (in view or edit mode)
custom_steps: WHEN BOC user clicks "Reject"
custom_expected:
THEN BOC users with edit permissions see a "Reject" button in grey when they are viewing a transaction (in view or edit mode) in a Submitted to BOC state. 
AND Clicking "Reject" will run all required field, and formatting checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. 
AND The transaction status is updated to "Rejected"
AND If the item was in edit mode, it is reloaded in view mode. 
AND A successful blue notification is displayed that states the transaction was rejected.
AND The item is removed from the player's history. 
AND The Approvals item is removed for the BOC.

title: As a Club user I want to receive a notification when an Assign as 7th Coach is rejected, approved or reversed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an Assign as 7th Coach tx exists for a Employee
AND a user is logged in as a club
custom_steps: WHEN Assign as 7th Coach tx reaches a rejected, approved or reversed status
custom_expected:
THEN a notification will appear on the notification clipboard 
AND Initiating Club (or the Club that the player belongs to) will receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Approved. 
Or Initiating Club (or the Club that the player belongs to) will receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Rejected.
Or Initiating Club (or the Club that the player belongs to) will receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Reversed, unless the transaction is also Suppressed. 
AND "Description" will be a hyperlink.
AND Clicking on the description hyperlink of any of these notifications will open the transaction in view mode in the same window/tab. 
AND Player's name will be a hyperlink.
AND Clicking on the player's name hyperlink of any of these notifications will open the player's profile in view mode in the same window/tab on the Player History tab.

title: As a user I want to edit an existing Assign as 7th Coach transaction
custom_preconds: GIVEN user with edit permission logs in
custom_steps: WHEN user opens an existing Assign as 7th Coach transaction
custom_expected:
THEN an Edit button will be available anytime the form is in view mode if the viewing user has edit permissions for the form in its current state.
AND Clicking Edit will reload the form in edit mode, and a Save button will appear in place of the Edit button (no edit button displayed in edit mode).
AND in Preliminary, the Club and BOC users will be able to edit all portions displayed on the form. 
OR In states other than Preliminary, edit only gives clubs access to attach new files. Club cannot edit existing attachments or any other part of transaction.
AND BOC is able to edit all fields in all states except for Approved and Reversed transactions.
AND In Approved and Reversed transactions, edit only gives BOC access to attach new files or edit existing attachments. They can also update "Comments" and AND "BOC Notes" fields, but they cannot edit any other part of transaction unless specifically stated in data discovery.
AND Clicking Save will always reload the form in View mode.

See Wireframe: 
http://aceshn.axshare.com/#p=voluntary_designation

title: Assign as 7th Coach - Viewer Permissions
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC or Club viewer account logs in
custom_steps: WHEN the user is in employee widget
custom_expected:
THEN they should have the following Viewer permission
-BOC users with a Viewer permission can*:
  -- Can view and Print all employee transactions in all states but cannot make any changes or e-sign.
  --Can view all flags for all transactions and transaction attachments in all states.

-Club users with a Viewer permission can*:
  --Club users with this role can view and print all employee transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transaction. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved employee currently belongs to.

          However, there are exceptions:
                  1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
                  2. They cannot edit or change these transactions (Basic only)
                  3. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field
 
 -Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) employee transactions including other club's employee transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
 
    1.  Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
    2.  Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the employee involved is 
         currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
    3. Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org

title: Remove as 7th Coach - Editor permissions
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC or Club admin account logs in
custom_steps: WHEN the user is in employee widget
custom_expected:
THEN they should have the following Editor permission
BOC users with a Editor permission can*:
 - Can view and Print all employee transactions [Club and BOC] in all states for Employees.
 - Can create, delete, edit, e-sign and submit all employee transactions for Employees. 
 - Can Approve, Reject, Reverse and Suppress all Employee transactions.

Club users with a Editor permission can:
- Club users with this role can view and print all minor league transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transactions. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved player currently belongs to.
However, there are exceptions:
1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
2. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field
- Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) minor league transactions including other club's Minor League transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
1. Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
2. Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the player involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org
3. Can create, delete, submit, edit, attach files, and e-sign all Minor League transactions for Minor League players on their Org's roster or if they are the"From Org" or "To Org".

title: Remove Employee from Org - Editor permissions
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC or Club admin account logs in
custom_steps: WHEN the user is in employee widget
custom_expected:
THEN they should have the following Editor permission 
BOC users with a Editor permission can:
 - Can view and Print all employee transactions [Club and BOC] in all states for Employees.
 - Can create, delete, edit, e-sign and submit all employee transactions for Employees. 
 - Can Approve, Reject, Reverse and Suppress all Employee transactions.

Club users with a Editor permission can:
 - Club users with this role can view and print all minor league transactions in all states when the logged 
    in Org matches the "From Org" for that transactions. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated 
    the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved player currently belongs to.
    However, there are exceptions:
    1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
    2. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field
 - Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) minor league transactions including 
    other club's Minor League transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
    1. Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
    2. Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To 
    Org. Note that even if the player involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the 
    comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
    Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org
    3. Can create, delete, submit, edit, attach files, and e-sign all Minor League transactions for Minor 
    League players on their Org's roster or if they are the"From Org" or "To Org".

title: As a user I want to submit a Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction to the BOC for approval

AND employee name is a hyperlink in the Approvals widget. Clicking on the employee name will open the profile (defaults to History tab) in the same window/tab. 
AND Type" will be a hyperlink. Clicking on the type hyperlink of a submitted transaction will open the submitted transaction in view mode in the same window/tab.
AND once the transaction has been successfully submitted, system creates an entry in employee's History in green font. Code = EETMPIN, Description = Place on Temporarily Inactive List, From Org.

title: As a user I want to edit an existing Place on Deceased List transaction
custom_preconds:
Data Discovery: https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Deceased+List
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with edit permissions for Deceased List tx
custom_steps: WHEN user opens a Place on Deceased List tx in view mode
custom_expected:
THEN an Edit button should be available anytime the form is in view mode if the viewing user has edit permissions for the form in its current state
AND clicking  Edit should reload the form in edit mode
AND a Save button should appear in place of the Edit button (no edit button displayed in edit mode)
AND in Preliminary state, the BOC users should be able to edit all portions displayed on the form
BUT club should not be able to edit existing attachments or any other part of transaction
AND BOC should be able to edit all fields in all states except for Approved and Reversed transactions
AND in Approved and Reversed transactions, edit should only give BOC access to attach new files or edit existing attachments. (They should also be able update "Comments" and "BOC Notes" fields)
BUT they should not be able to edit any other part of transaction unless specifically stated in data discovery
AND a Save button should be available anytime the form is in edit mode
AND clicking Save should save the transaction and it's current values and reload the form in View mode
AND transaction status should be set to "Preliminary" if this is the first time the transaction is being saved. Otherwise the transaction status should not change
AND after a successful save the system should display a successful save blue notification
AND whenever the form is in edit mode, the user should see a "Cancel" button on the form in grey
AND clicking "Cancel" should prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel the changes they have made
AND if they confirm the cancellation and the form has not yet been saved in the system, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction
BUT if they confirm the cancellation and the form has been previously saved in the system, then the form should be reloaded into view mode, with none of the edits that were made since the last save and up to the cancellation point reflected
AND if they do not confirm the cancellation then the user should be returned to the form and no action should be taken

custom_steps:

ADMINS:

* Can view all flags for all transactions and transaction attachments in all states.
* Can create, delete, edit, e-sign and submit all Employee transactions for Employees (or players where applicable). 
* Can Approve, Reject, Reverse and Suppress all Employee transactions and see associated Flags.

BASIC:
* Can view and Print all employee transactions [Club and BOC] in all states for employees but cannot make any changes or e-sign.
* Can view all flags for all transactions and transaction attachments in all states.

title: Reinstate from Inactive List Permissions - Club - Employee Transactions
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
BASIC:
* Club users with this role can view and print all employee transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transaction. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved employee currently belongs too.

          However, there are exceptions:
                  1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
                  2. They cannot edit or change these transactions (Basic only)
                  3. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field
 
* Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) employee transactions including other club's employee transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
 
    1.  Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
    2. Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the employee involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
    3. Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org

ADMIN:

* Club users with this role can view and print all employee transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transactions. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved employee currently belongs too.
 
      However, there are exceptions:
      1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
      2. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field

* Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) employee transactions including other club's employee transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
 
      1.  Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
      2. Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the employee involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
      3. Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org
 
* Can NOT create, delete, submit, edit, or attach files to any BOC only employee transactions for employees.

title: As a user I want to submit a Reinstate from Inactive List transaction to the BOC for approval
custom_steps:
See Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/9.+Reinstate+from+IL

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Reinstate+from+Inactive+List

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Transactions+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria:
* Submit to BOC button is available to Club users when the transaction is in a preliminary or rejected state in edit mode or view mode. The button is blue. 
* Submit button is available for BOC users when the transaction is in a preliminary or rejected state in edit mode or view mode. The button is grey.
* Clicking Submit will run a required field and format check according to the data discovery. If any fields are missing or formatted incorrectly, user will receive an error message. 
* Clicking Submit will run the On Submit rules check (each covered in other stories - this story assumes they all pass).
* After the rules have passed, the system updates the status of the transaction to "Submitted to BOC"  
* System reloads the transaction in view mode, and displays a successful submit blue notification.  
* Once the transaction has successfully been submitted, the system sets the employee's pending Status to whatever it was prior to their being placed on the Inactive List. 
* When a transaction reaches a status of "Submitted to BOC" an approval item will be generated and display on the BOC - Employee Transactions - Admin's Approvals widget. 
* If a file is attached to the transaction, that is displayed and available for download from the Attachments column of the Approvals widget. 
* If Comments are populated on the transaction, they display in the Comments column of the Approvals widget.
* Employee name is a hyperlink in the Approvals widget. Clicking on the employee name will open the profile (defaults to History tab) in the same window/tab. 
* "Type" will be a hyperlink. Clicking on the type hyperlink of a submitted transaction will open the submitted transaction in view mode in the same window/tab.
* Once the transaction has been successfully submitted, system creates an entry in employee's History in green font. Code = EERSTIL, Description = Reinstate from (Inactive List) - with (Inactive List) replaced with the type of inactive list they are being reinstated from, From Org.

title: As a BOC user I want to approve or reject a Reinstate From Inactive List transaction
custom_steps:
See Approval/Rejection Updates: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/9.+Reinstate+from+IL

See Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Transactions+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria:
APPROVE:
* BOC Approvers see an "Approve" button in blue when they are viewing a transaction (in view or edit mode) in Preliminary or Submitted to BOC if applicable. 
* Clicking "Approve" will run all required field, formatting and On Approve rules checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. 
* Once all rules have passed or been overridden, the transaction status is updated to "Approved"
* If the item was in edit mode, it is reloaded in view mode. 
* A successful blue notification is displayed that states the transaction was approved.  
* Update Player's Player History: Code = EERSTIL , Description = Reinstate from (Inactive List) , From Org fields to be in black font. 


REJECT:
* Clicking "Reject" will run all required field and formatting checks and display any relevant error or warning messages (all covered in previous stories). 
* Once all On Save rules have passed or been overridden, the transaction status is updated to "Rejected"
* Successful reject notification is displayed. 
* If the item was on the Approvals Clipboard, that is removed from the approvals clipboard. 
* Remove pending history entry.

title: As a user I want to edit an existing Reinstate from Inactive List transaction for an employee
custom_steps:
See Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Reinstate+from+Inactive+List

Acceptance Criteria:
* An Edit button will be available anytime the form is in view mode if the viewing user has edit permissions for the form in its current state. 
* Clicking  Edit will reload the form in edit mode, and a Save button will appear in place of the Edit button (no edit button displayed in edit mode). 
* In Preliminary or Rejected state, Club users will be able to edit all portions displayed on the form. 
* BOC is able to edit all fields in all states except for Approved and Reversed transactions. 
* In Approved and Reversed transactions, edit only gives Clubs access to attach new files, but they cannot edit any other part of transaction unless specifically stated in data discovery.
* In Approved and Reversed transactions, edit only gives BOC access to attach new files or edit existing attachments. They can also update "Comments" and "BOC Notes" fields, but they cannot edit any other part of transaction unless specifically stated in data discovery.
* A Save button will be available anytime the form is in edit mode. 
* Clicking Save will save the transaction and it's current values and reload the form in View mode.
* Transaction status will be set to "Preliminary" if this is the first time the transaction is being saved. Otherwise the transaction status will not change.  
* After a successful save the system will display a successful save blue notification. 
* Whenever the form is in edit mode, the user will see a "Cancel" button on the form in grey. 
* Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel the changes they have made. 
* If they confirm the cancellation and the form has not yet been saved in the system, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction. 
* If they confirm the cancellation and the form has been previously saved in the system, then the form should be reloaded into view mode, with none of the edits that were made since the last save and up to the cancellation point reflected.
* If they do not confirm the cancellation then the user will be returned to the form and no action will be taken.
